details:
Multiple security issues have been found in Ming. They may lead
to the execution of arbitrary code or causing application crash.


* [CVE-2016-9264](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-9264)
global-buffer-overflow in printMP3Headers
* [CVE-2016-9265](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-9265)
divide-by-zero in printMP3Headers
* [CVE-2016-9266](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-9266)
left shift in listmp3.c
* [CVE-2016-9827](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-9827)
listswf: heap-based buffer overflow in \_iprintf
* [CVE-2016-9828](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-9828)
listswf: heap-based buffer overflow in \_iprintf
* [CVE-2016-9829](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-9829)
listswf: NULL pointer dereference in dumpBuffer
* [CVE-2016-9831](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-9831)
listswf: heap-based buffer overflow in parseSWF\_RGBA


For Debian 7 Wheezy, these problems have been fixed in version
0.4.4-1.1+deb7u1.


We recommend that you upgrade your ming packages.


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
